content: What is the correct method I should use to get the string with the name of a class in Python?

In Python, you can obtain the name of a class as a string using the `__name__` attribute of the class. Here's a simple example to demonstrate how you can achieve this:

```python
class MyClass:
    pass

# Get the name of the class
class_name = MyClass.__name__

print(class_name)  # Output: MyClass
```

In this example, `MyClass.__name__` retrieves the name of the class `MyClass` as a string.

If you have an instance of the class and want to get the class name, you can use the `__class__` attribute of the instance:

```python
# Create an instance of the class
my_instance = MyClass()

# Get the name of the class from the instance
class_name_from_instance = my_instance.__class__.__name__

print(class_name_from_instance)  # Output: MyClass
```

This will give you the class name from the instance of the class. Both approaches are straightforward and commonly used in Python to retrieve class names.
